meanings.definition: Doomed to evil, misery, or misfortune.
meanings.sent1: The accurst witch cast a dark shadow over the village.
meanings.sent2: The accurst land seemed to bring only sorrow to those who lived on it.
meanings.sent3: The accurst cat knocked over the milk again, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: The accurst storm clouds loomed ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The accurst curse followed him wherever he went, like a dark cloud.

meanings.definition: Deserving to be cursed or damned.
meanings.sent1: The accurst criminal showed no remorse for his actions.
meanings.sent2: The accurst traitor betrayed his friends without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The accurst bully finally got what he deserved when karma caught up to him.
meanings.sent4: The accurst lie spread like wildfire, tarnishing his reputation.
meanings.sent5: The accurst deed haunted his conscience, a constant reminder of his wrongdoing.

meanings.sent1: The accurst treasure was said to bring misfortune to all who possessed it.
meanings.sent2: The accurst ghost haunted the old mansion, scaring away any potential buyers.
meanings.sent3: The accurst mirror seemed to reflect only bad luck and sorrow.
meanings.sent4: The accurst pact sealed their fate, binding them together in eternal damnation.
meanings.sent5: The accurst mark burned on his skin like a brand, a constant reminder of his curse.
